intro: Ayapana pyramidalis, commonly known as the pyramidal ayapana, is a species of flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus plants. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stem and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are ovate and covered in a fine, fuzzy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Ayapana pyramidalis is often found growing in moist, shaded environments within its native habitat.
